column4: if this is a password protected, or a multiple volume rar file, then you will need the unrar non-free package.
the free unrar will not be able to unpack a multiple volume rar archive.
LjL I think "they" renamed it to "unrar" without the non-free part.
sudo apt-get install unrar
if you are on edgy: start synaptic package manager. click "settings" -> "repositories". check universe and multiverse. click close. click reload.
try "whereis unrar"
unrar: /usr/share/man/man1/unrar.1.gz
so you have installed it but manually deleted it maybe... you should have gotten unrar: /usr/bin/unrar /usr/X11R6/bin/unrar /usr/bin/X11/unrar /usr/share/man/man1/unrar.1.gz
run "gconf-editor" and go to /apps/gnome-btdownload/settings. there you can set the min and max port.
ok
if you're using gnome then a right click on the iso file should give you an option to burn it if i'm not mistaken...
should be it, yes. (i'm not using gnome atm)
and in that window you should have a "write to disc" button...
does the cd/dvd creator show you just the iso file or the contents of the iso?
graveman is quite simple and nice otherwise.
whi is graveman???
if the "cd/dvd creator" does not work for you graveman is a cd/dvd burner that is simple and easy to use. http://graveman.tuxfamily.org/screenshot.php?l=e
will it burn .iso , i am trying to burn ubuntu 6.10 which i downloded
yes. in graveman you just click on "duplicate disc", select the iso in "duplicate from" and the burner in "write to" then click on "write tracks"
okay thanx :)
firstly i will try K3B :)
